snippet: Professor Bryce-Laporte headed one of the nation’s first African-American studies departments, emphasizing that black studies must address hot-button topics like racial stereotyping while retaining academic rigor.
abstract: Roy S Bryce-Laporte, sociologist who led one of the nation's first African-American studies departments, at Yale University, dies at age 78.
lead_paragraph: Professor Bryce-Laporte headed one of the nation’s first African-American studies departments, emphasizing that black studies must address hot-button topics like racial stereotyping while retaining academic rigor.

headline.seo: Roy Bryce-Laporte, Who Led Black Studies Program at Yale, Dies at 78
headline.main: Roy S. Bryce-Laporte, Who Led Black Studies at Yale, Dies at 78
headline.print_headline: Roy S. Bryce-Laporte, 78; Led Black Studies at Yale
